page.description: The PDF_ENCRYPT() function adds password security to a PDF file.. User_password is optional.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = PDF_Encrypt(C source_File ,C result_File ,C owner_password ,C user_password ,L canPrint ,L canModifyDocument ,L canCopy ,L canAddNotes [,L use128BitKey ])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: .T. = Indicates the operation was successful. .F. = Indicates the operation failed.

argument.name: source_File
argument.description: The name of the PDF file to encrypt.

argument.name: result_File
argument.description: The name of the new encrypted PDF file.

argument.name: owner_password
argument.description: The password of the author of the PDF file.

argument.name: user_password
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (no password). The password of the reader of the PDF file.

argument.name: canPrint
argument.description:
Logical. .T. = The user is allowed to print the from the PDF document.
.F. = The user is not allowed to print from the PDF document.

argument.name: canModifyDocument
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = The user is allowed to edit the PDF document.
.F. = The user is not allowed to edit the PDF document.

argument.name: canCopy
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = The user is allowed to copy content from the PDF document.
.F. = The user is not allowed to copy content from the PDF document.

argument.name: canAddNotes
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = The user is allowed to add notes to the PDF document.
.F. = The user is not allowed to add notes to the PDF document.

argument.name: use128BitKey
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = Use 128 bit encryption.
.F. = Do not use 128 bit encryption.
